bibl.title: A Circular Letter and a Memo (P. Mich. Inv. 6980).
bibl.note: Arsinoite Nome, 223 or 181 BCE. The papyrus belongs to a lot of about 100 papyri of mummy cartonage. The front contains a circular letter. It first addresses the strategos and then a wide range of the police and the administrative officials of the Arsinoe nome. The back seems to contain an incomplete memo or order to write another circular letter or a series of letters to the strategos of the Memphite nome, and to financial and police officials subordinate to him.
MÜLLER Martin, A Circular Letter and a Memo (P. Mich. Inv. 6980).
